image.altText: A woman and man with serious expressions stand close together in front of a caravan park

props.synopsis: After rebuilding their Riverland caravan park in the wake of a devastating flood, Barbara and Geoff Calvert are facing a new challenge — surging insurance premiums.

title.children: South Australians deal with rising insurance premiums following floods and fires

image.altText: Stewart Johnston, standing in a crowd, frowns as he speaks to reporters.

props.synopsis: Stewart Johnston, who remained a high-profile advocate for reform in the aged care sector following the abuse scandal at Oakden, has been sentenced to just over a year in jail after earlier pleading guilty to a charge of knowingly possessing child exploitation material.

title.children: Oakden campaigner Stewart Johnston jailed for possessing child exploitation material

image.altText: A man hunches over a reel-to-reel tape player.

props.synopsis: Samuel Beckett's plays challenged the norm in the mid-20th century, so it's fitting that a director who champions new writers should open the Adelaide Festival with his major work, Krapp's Last Tape.

title.children: Samuel Beckett an ongoing champion for new writing at Adelaide Festival

image.altText: A man wearing a blue hair net and a dark blue shirt with Vili's logo on it takes a tray of pies out the oven

props.synopsis: The wife of Vili Milisits, the founder of one of South Australia's most popular bakeries, has filed a wrongful death lawsuit against a neuropsychologist who she says wrongfully diagnosed her husband with Alzheimer's disease.

title.children: Wife of Vili's bakery founder claims he was misdiagnosed with Alzheimer's before his death

image.altText: A crowd of protesters, with one holding a sign reading 'enough is enough'.

props.synopsis: SA Police respond to 100 domestic incidents and issue nine intervention orders on average each day, the state's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence has heard.

title.children: SA Police respond to 100 domestic incidents a day, royal commission hears

image.altText: A man with his biological father.

props.synopsis: Donor-conceived South Australians will now have greater access to knowledge about their biological parents – even in cases where donors were previously guaranteed anonymity.

title.children: Donor parents to be disclosed to their biological children on new register

image.altText: Young smiling girl, braces wears blue tee with surf culture australia written, holds surfboard, house, white sand in background.

props.synopsis: Home Education Association says the number of people choosing to homeschool their children is growing. However, an academic warns it may not be for everyone.

title.children: Lily loves going surfing. It's all part of her formal schooling

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: A defence lawyer has told a jury to consider whether his client acted in self-defence when he shot and killed Steven Murphy at his Kudla property in Adelaide's north in 2023.

title.children: Lawyer asks jury to consider if murder accused acted in self-defence

image.altText: A smiling woman with tattoos on her arm wearing glasses sitting in a black wheelchair

props.synopsis: Belle Owen was excited to buy her first home, but it was not exactly perfect – a year in, it still is not fully accessible. There are hopes recent changes to the National Construction Code will improve housing options, but some advocates say it does not go far enough.

title.children: Inaccessible housing means people are 'crawling' to get to their own bathrooms

image.altText: Portrait of Seann Miley Moore, a Filipino Australian person, leaning against a poster of David Bowie, strung with fairy lights.

props.synopsis: As rights for trans people around the world come under threat, a new production of Hedwig and the Angry Inch comes to the stage.

title.children: In 2020, this musical was canned. Now's the right time for its return

image.altText: Steelworks with man in the foreground

props.synopsis: BlueScope Steel is negotiating with the administrators of the Whyalla Steelworks to join as an expert advisor, but industry insiders believe it may also be interested in a more permanent arrangement.

title.children: BlueScope negotiates Whyalla advisory role as it weighs up takeover

image.altText: A man in a plaid yellow shirt, glasses and face mask walks out of court being questioned by reporters.

props.synopsis: Former massage therapist Sumit Satish Rastogi, who has pleaded guilty to almost 100 sexual abuse offences against 40 women, has resorted to telling an Adelaide judge "I beg you" while asking for "one more day" on bail — but the request was knocked back on the basis it was "inappropriate" for him to remain in the community.

title.children: Massage therapist who sexually abused 40 women 'begs' to stay on bail

image.altText: Two men standing with fruit vines in the background

props.synopsis: A 15-kilometre "suspension zone" was enacted in January after Queensland fruit fly maggots were found in homegrown peaches at Glynde, north-east of the Adelaide CBD. Two Adelaide Hills strawberry growers are calling for changes to national fruit fly protocols.

title.children: After fruit fly was found in the suburbs, growers can't sell in the hills

image.altText: Police officers look inside cardboard boxes outside a shed with a truck nearby

props.synopsis: Police say they have seized almost $800,000 worth of tobacco and $66,000 in cash after raiding 10 properties in the state's south-east.

title.children: One arrest after police seize tobacco and cash in SA raids

image.altText: An artist's projection of the Hydrostor facility near Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: An old mine in Broken Hill will be re-purposed by Canadian company Hydrostor as an "innovative" renewable energy storage and generation project tipped to create hundreds of local construction jobs.

title.children: Green light for nation's first underground compressed air energy plant

image.altText: An older gentleman with grey facial hair and a blue collared shirt stands in a kitchen with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: What are the key issues on your mind this federal election? We want to know.

title.children: 'Struggling to breathe': Cost of living top of mind for voters as federal election looms

image.altText: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf walks toward a court.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court case over the alleged unlawful termination of Antoinette Lattouf is nearing its conclusion, with the presenter's legal team delivering their closing arguments today. Take a look back at our live blog.

title.children: Court urged to find race as a reason for Lattouf being taken off air — as it happened

image.altText: A man wearing a light pink collared business shirt and blue suit jacket gestures with his right hand while persenting.

props.synopsis: Software giant WiseTech is in turmoil after a series of allegations were made against its founder. Here's what the scandal is about, and why it's costing the publicly-listed company billions of dollars in market value.

title.children: Richard White has lost billions as WiseTech's share price has collapsed

image.altText: A mother and daughter sit together on a bed using a tablet.

props.synopsis: As schools ask parents to read hundreds of thousands of words to consent to technology usage in classrooms, who's protecting their children's data?

title.children: Kim was asked to approve her daughter's use of classroom apps — by reading 200,000 words

image.altText: A bright red and white Coles sign at a supermarket at night.

props.synopsis: Coles reveals its half-year profit dropped 3 per cent — though it is not because groceries are getting cheaper. Its CEO Leah Weckert says the company received a $120 million boost to sales after rival Woolworths was affected by industrial action before Christmas.

title.children: Coles profit drops 3 per cent, gets $120m sales boost from Woolworths strikes

image.altText: Yarden Bibas in emotional eulogy to wife and sons in Israel

props.synopsis: Yarden Bibas told mourners it was the closest he had been to his wife since October 7, and it was breaking him that he could not hug her and his two sons.

title.children: 'Sorry I couldn't protect you': Father of Israeli hostage family lays wife and children to rest

image.altText: Aerial view of some houses and a field

props.synopsis: Looking to lower your insurance premiums? Here's what the experts think about the strategies ABC readers used to get ahead.

title.children: How our readers lowered their home insurance premiums

image.altText: Actor Michelle Trachtenberg dressed in black at a Gala

props.synopsis: Michelle Trachtenberg, who is known for her roles in Gossip Girl and Buffy the Vampire Slayer, has died at 39.

title.children: Former Gossip Girl and Buffy star Michelle Trachtenberg dead at 39

image.altText: Aaron Woods holds an NRL ball with "TRUMP" emblazoned on it while a male Fox presenter holds a microphone between them.

props.synopsis: Two domestic violence prevention organisations that have worked with the NRL have criticised its approaches to Donald Trump and Dana White, asking them to attend season-opening games in Las Vegas this weekend.

title.children: White Ribbon steps away from NRL after 'tone deaf' Trump invitation

image.altText: Home units

props.synopsis: It's about 20 months quicker to save for an entry-priced unit than a house, new data shows, with the difference even greater in Sydney and Canberra. A Domain report shows mortgage stress now affects couples aged 25 to 34 paying off a house in all capital cities except Darwin.

title.children: Entry-priced units give first-home buyers 20-month headstart over houses

image.altText: An image of the logo of the World Health Organization in Geneva.

props.synopsis: Health authorities are being hindered by the remote location of two villages that have reported outbreaks.

title.children: What we know about the mystery illness that has killed 53 in Congo

image.altText: Maya Joint, wearing a white visor and green dress, hitting a forehand

props.synopsis: Australian teenager Maya Joint causes a massive boilover in Mexico, toppling world number 20 Donna Vekic to reach the quarterfinals.

title.children: Aussie teen causes boilover as she prepares to crack the top 100

image.altText: An adult lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Private health insurance premiums will rise by an average of 3.73 per cent from April, after multiple rounds of negotiations between the federal government and insurers.

title.children: Here's how much your private health insurance is going up by

image.altText: A portrait shot of Kimberly, staring straight at the camera, wearing a black shirt.

props.synopsis: Many patients with complex conditions remain frustrated by out-of-pocket costs for specialist practitioners, where Medicare rebates are often a small fraction of the overall bill.

title.children: $750 for one visit: Why latest Medicare boost won't help sickest patients

image.altText: A woman holidng a newborn inside a hospital

props.synopsis: Policy efforts to incentivise companies and Koreans to embrace parenthood have started to pay off — but not for everyone

title.children: South Korea birthrate rises for first time in nine years, along with marriages

image.altText: A woman with straight dark hair and a pink shirt smiles while sitting outside a red brick building surrounded by greenery.

props.synopsis: Australia's housing industry and regulators aren't keeping up with the desire to build smaller, denser housing in cities around the country, including regional centres, experts say.

title.children: Australia is in the middle of a culture shift to smaller homes, experts say

image.altText: A photo of a Qatar Airways plane taking off.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers approves Qatar's 25 per cent stake in Virgin with strict conditions, while tech giant Nvidia reports strong fourth-quarter results. Follow live.

title.children: Nvidia posts strong results, treasurer approves Qatar-Virgin deal, ASX opens higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Diversity isn't just about gender: ASIC chairman
ASIC chairman say he's crypto neutral

image.altText: Penny Wong from the side.

props.synopsis: Australia's foreign policy priorities include our strategic position in the Pacific, expanding economic ties with South-East Asia and broadening ties with regional powers like India and Japan.

title.children: Australia weighs boosting foreign aid in event Trump slashes US funding

image.altText: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy listens during a news conference.

props.synopsis: Busy Ukrainian officials are working tirelessly to secure a lasting peace deal and end the war with Russia, but not all agree on the latest approach from the US and Donald Trump.

title.children: Ukraine's war room fears a ceasefire could be a 'Russian trap'

image.altText: Illustration of 75 year old woman with walking stick and electric fans warm yellow and peach colour tones.

props.synopsis: Your body could be prematurely ageing if you live in a location with as many as 190 days of extreme heat a year, according to a new US study.

title.children: 'Comparable to smoking': Prolonged heat may age you faster, study suggests
